summary: This document is a compilation of daily lieutenant's logs from the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York for August 9-10, 2019. It details routine prison operations and, most significantly, records the medical emergency and death of inmate Jeffrey Epstein on the morning of August 10, 2019.

persons.name: Epstein
persons.context: Inmate #76318-054 who was found unresponsive in his cell (Z06-220) on the morning of August 10, 2019. CPR was performed and he was transported to a local hospital.

persons.name: Fernandez
persons.context: Inmate #86824-054 who was placed in a dry cell under staff watch and later transferred to special housing (dry cell).

persons.name: Mutimura
persons.context: Inmate #76329-054 who was received into the institution during the afternoon lockdown count on August 9, 2019.

persons.name: Carreon-Macias
persons.context: Inmate #82858-198 who was released on bail bond on the afternoon of August 9, 2019.

persons.name: Lt. M.
persons.context: Lieutenant who relieved the Day Watch Operations Lieutenant of duties on the afternoon of August 9, 2019.

events.title: Death of Jeffrey Epstein
events.description: Inmate Jeffrey Epstein (#76318-054) was found unresponsive in his cell (Z06-220) in Unit 9 South. CPR was initiated, 911 was called, and he was transported via ambulance to a local hospital while CPR continued.

events.title: Inmate Mutimura Received
events.description: Inmate Mutimura (#76329-054) was received into the institution during the afternoon lockdown count.

events.title: Inmate Carreon-Macias Released
events.description: Inmate Carreon-Macias (#82858-198) was released on bail bond.

events.title: Inmate Fernandez Transferred to Dry Cell
events.description: Inmate Fernandez (#86824-054) was transferred to special housing (a dry cell).

events.title: Inmates Transferred to Psych Observation
events.description: Inmates #78640-054 and #85775-054 were transferred to special housing for psychological observation.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center, New York, NY
keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein (inmate #76318-054) was found unresponsive in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center at approximately 6:33 AM on August 10, 2019.
CPR was performed on Epstein by prison staff and continued by EMTs after an ambulance arrived. He was transported to a local hospital while CPR was still in progress.
The prison log indicates multiple inmates were on psychological observation or suicide watch with inmate companions in the days leading up to Epstein's death.
Several prison systems were malfunctioning on the day of Epstein's death, including the fire alarm/pump system and the public address system used for PREA announcements.
The log shows routine prison operations, counts, and inmate movements (receipts, releases, transfers to special housing) occurring alongside the emergency incident.
